intro: Elaeodendron capense, commonly known as the yellow mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Loranthaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and yellowish, fleshy leaves. The plant attaches itself to host trees, such as yellowwoods, and derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized roots. It produces small, white flowers followed by red, fleshy berries that are dispersed by birds. Its ecological role includes providing food for various wildlife species and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
